column1: East Lake-Orient Park is an unincorporated census-designated place in Hillsborough County
column6: 703 at the 2000 census following an expansion of its borders. The area is the home of the Florida State Fairgrounds
column7: which hosts the Florida State Fair in mid-February of each year. It was previously home to East Lake Square Mall. The East Lake Park Civic Club in conjunction with the ELP Special Dependent District (www.eastlakepark.org) manage and maintain this beautiful neighborhood. The ZIP code for East Lake-Orient Park is 33610 (East Lake) and 33619 (Orient Park).

column1: East Lake-Orient Park is located in north-central Hillsborough County at 27°58′42″N 82°22′26″W (27.978399
column2: -82.374017). The CDP includes the communities of East Lake
column4: and Del Rio. It is bordered by the city of Tampa to the south and west
column6: Thonotosassa and Mango to the east
column7: and Brandon to the southeast. U.S. Route 301 and Interstate 4 run through the community
column8: crossing near the center of the CDP. US 301 leads northeast 21 miles (34 km) to Zephyrhills and south 9 miles (14 km) to Riverview
column9: while I-4 leads east 27 miles (43 km) to Lakeland and west 8 miles (13 km) to downtown Tampa. Interstate 75 forms the eastern edge of the East Lake-Orient Park CDP
column10: leading north 93 miles (150 km) to Ocala and south 42 miles (68 km) to Bradenton.

column1: East Lake Square Mall was a shopping mall located within the area. It was opened in 1976 and operated until 1998
column2: when sales and customer volume declined sharply after the opening of the Brandon Town Center in nearby Brandon. The mall featured several major retailers and a branch library
column3: which moved its operations to nearby Mango after the mall's closing. The mall was quickly converted to a commercial complex called Netpark.
